intro: Conostegia galeottii, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are glossy and elliptical, often with a waxy texture, and it produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds. Conostegia galeottii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry woodlands.
